intro: Willoughbya argyreia, commonly known as the velvet tassel plant, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking, velvety purple bracts that resemble tassels. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Willoughbya argyreia is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
